body:
(Combined) injections currently have multiple problems:

## I.

Highlights from a tree can appear both in front and behind highlights with the same priority of:
1. ancestor trees, 
2. sibling trees (of the same language, and of a different language)
3. regular extmarks

If the given highlight is multiline, and other highlight was added on line 2+ of the given highlight.

This is easiest to see with combined injections, since the highlight can span across unrelated highlights from parent trees.

Possible fixes:
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31812 - offset child highlights by internal subpriority. Priorities stay the same. Fixes issues with both ancestor trees and regular extmarks. Can be extended to siblings
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31853 - offset child highlights by priority. Mostly fixes issues with both ancestor trees and regular extrmarks. Can be extended to siblings
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32569 - create new highlights iterator for each line. Fixes issue with ancestor and sibling trees. Potential performance problem
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32619 - Store relevant highlights and reapply them for each line. Fixes issue with ancestor and sibling trees.

Merging either of them will surface a limitation that parent highlights sometimes need to be in front of child highlights. Example is template string literals. The interpolated expression should be on top of all children.

## II.

Child trees can include ranges outside their parent's region. This can happen if a (parent) combined injection contains another (child) combined injection, and the match for child injection was split across multiple ranges of parent injection.

Possible fixes:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32549 - clip child tree region to parent trees regions. (This is not correct? It should only clip against one parent tree that the match belongs to)

## III.

Highlights of a child tree can appear outside their region. This can happen if a highlight spans across multiple ranges of the tree.

Requires II is fixed. Harder to test without fixing I.

Possible fixes:

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32549 - Clip highlight ranges to tree region.
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/32624 - same as previous.

## IV.

(Theoretical) Combined child injection trees might not be created. Tree sitter requires ranges in tree region to be sorted and non-intersecting. Currently the ranges are passed in the encounter order, so nothing guarantees they will not intersect or be sorted.

_Originally posted by @vanaigr in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/32624#issuecomment-2682539765_
title: Treesitter: combined injections tracking issue
